Description: Sets the name of the server to be displayed in the server list
Sets a description of the server to be displayed in the server list

Comma separated list of up to 5 server tags to display in the server list. Available tags: 0 (PvP), 1 (PvE), 2 (EXP Multiplier), 3 (Gathering Rate), 4 (Keep Inventory), 5 (45 day wipe), 6 (15 day wipe), 7 (30 day wipe), 8 (60 day wipe)
Sets a unique ID for the server. Default = random 8 digit number
Sets the password required to connect to the server. Default is no password
Sets the maximum number of players that may connect to the server at one time
Semi-colon separated list of [Steam64 IDs](https://www.steamidfinder.com/) of server admins
If enabled, the special admin icon will be shown
If set, the server's anticheat system will be enabled
Sets the next date on which all server data will be wiped. Format: YYYY-MM-DD
Sets the server framerate
Sets the server autosave interval
Sets the number of backups performed by the server each day
Sets the period after which a backup will be overwritten by new backups

If enabled, Steam servers will be used for network penetration. Enable this if you don't have a public IP but want to allow players from outside your network to join the server. DON'T enable this if you have a public IP. This setting will impact server latency
Specifies additional command line parameters that are not otherwise set by AMP. ONE LINE ONLY! Use with care
If set, PvE mode will be enabled, and PvP mode disabled. In PvP mode, players can attack other players and their structures. In PvE mode they cannot
If enabled, players can damage themselves
If enabled, squadmates can damage each other
If enabled, realistic physics behaviour will apply to vehicles, stopping them drifting on corners
Sets the maximum number of members allowed for each squad
Sets the stack limit for each type of item
When enabled, all recipes and talents will be unlocked for new characters
Sets how many inventory slots a new character gets by default
If enabled, new characters will receive novice protection
Semi-colon separated list of items a character gets on respawn. Format: ItemID, Quality, Amount
Sets the mode for dropping items on death

EnumValues.2: Drop inventory (not equipped or hotkey items)

Description: Sets the amount of time after which items dropped on death will disappear
Sets which players can loot corpses
If enabled, creatures and structures will drop items when killed/destroyed
If enabled, players can discard items
Sets the amount of time after which items discarded will disappear
Sets the basic (or starting) revival cooldown duration
Sets the amount of time by which the revival cooldown increases after multiple deaths
Sets the maximum number of death cooldown penalties to be applied
Sets the time after which stacked revival cooldowns are reset
If enabled, structures will decay
Sets the maximum distance at which a player can see a squadmate's name
Sets the maximum distance at which a player can see a non-squadmate's name
Sets the maximum distance at which a player can see an NPC's name
If enabled, the location of other players' beacons will be displayed on the map
If enabled, players will be able to send chat messages in-game
If enabled, blood effects will appear when damaged
If set, the profanity filter will be disabled
If enabled, the wounded state will be triggered when HP falls to 0, rather than the player immediately dying
Sets the amount of time after which animal NPC corpses will disappear
Sets the amount of time after which human NPC corpses will disappear
Sets the maximum number of beacons each player can build
Sets the maximum number of traps that can be within beacon coverage
Sets the maximum number of turrets that can be within beacon coverage
Sets the amount of time daily that beacons can be attacked
Sets the multiplier for the time before dead wild NPCs can respawn
Sets the multiplier for the cooldown time between supply deliveries
Sets the multiplier for character heat resistance
Sets the multiplier for character cold resistance
On death, the durability of equipped items will fall by the maximum durability multiplied by this amount (does not affect drops)
On death, the durability of hotbar items will fall by the maximum durability multiplied by this amount (does not affect drops)
Sets the multiplier for the item crafting/repair time
Sets the multiplier for all XP earned
Sets the multiplier for XP earned from killing monsters
Sets the multiplier for XP earned from collecting resources
Sets the multiplier for XP earned from crafting items
Sets the multiplier for movement speed
Sets the multiplier for jump height
Sets the multiplier for damage taken from falls
Sets the multiplier for maximum HP
Sets the amount by which HP recovery will be multiplied
Sets the multiplier for maximum stamina
Sets the amount by which stamina recovery will be multiplied
Sets the multiplier for the stamina consumption speed
Sets the multiplier for maximum fullness
Sets the multiplier for the fullness consumption speed
Sets the multiplier for the amount of fullness recovered by eating
Sets the multiplier for maximum hydration
Sets the multiplier for the hydration consumption speed
Sets the multiplier for the amount of hydration recovered by drinking
Sets the multiplier for maximum oxygen
Sets the amount by which oxygen recovery will be multiplied
Sets the multiplier for the oxygen consumption speed
Sets the multiplier for the amount of HP recovered from medication
Sets the multiplier applied to the duration of effect of food and medication
DisplayName: Food And Medication Effect Duration Multiplier

Description: Sets the multiplier for the amount of items dropped by a wild NPC on death
Sets the multiplier for the starting level of wild NPCs, making them more powerful
Sets the multiplier for the damage dealt by wild NPCs
Sets the multiplier for the HP of wild NPCs. Minimum is 0.1
Sets the multiplier for the movement speed of wild NPCs. Minimum is 0.1
Sets the multiplier for the level of raid NPCs, making them more powerful
Sets the multiplier for the damage dealt by raid NPCs
Sets the multiplier for the HP of raid NPCs. Minimum is 0.1
Sets the multiplier for the movement speed of raid NPCs. Minimum is 0.1
Sets the multiplier for the total number of raid NPCs summoned each round. Minimum is 0.1
Sets the multiplier for the amount of resources received upon collection
Sets the multiplier for the amount of items dropped by a raid NPC upon death
Sets the multiplier for the maximum number of work-type structures each player can build
Sets multiplier for the damage taken by structures other than traps, turrets and beacons
Sets the multiplier for the damage taken by traps
Sets the multiplier for the damage taken by turrets
Sets the multiplier for the damage dealt by traps
Sets the multiplier for the damage dealt by turrets
Sets the multiplier for the maximum durability of structures. Minimum is 0.1
Sets the multiplier for the durability recovery speed of placed structures
Sets the multiplier for the durability recovery speed of structures within the auto-repair range of a beacon
Sets the multiplier for resources collected from oil wells
Sets the multiplier for resources collected from dew collectors
Sets the multiplier for resources collected from mines
Sets the multiplier for resources collected from fish baskets
Sets the multiplier for the damage that beacons take from player firearms
DisplayName: Beacon Player Gun Damage Resistance Multiplier

Description: Sets the multiplier for the damage that beacons take from player vehicles
DisplayName: Beacon Player Vehicle Damage Resistance Multiplier

Description: Sets the multiplier for the damage that beacons take from NPCs
Sets the multiplier for the maximum gains from collection. This value must be bigger than other collection multipliers
Sets the multiplier for the amount of wood collected
Sets the multiplier for the amount of plants collected
Sets the multiplier for the amount of ore collected
Sets the multiplier for the amount of crops collected
Sets the multiplier for the amount of items collected from corpses
Sets the multiplier for the growth speed of planted crops
Sets the multiplier for melee weapon damage that characters deal to NPCs
Sets the multiplier for ranged weapon damage that characters deal to NPCs
Sets the multiplier for melee weapon damage that characters deal to players
Sets the multiplier for ranged weapon damage that characters deal to players
Sets the multiplier for melee weapon damage that characters deal to structures
Sets the multiplier for ranged weapon damage that characters deal to structures
Sets the multiplier for the damage that tools deal to resources
Sets the multiplier for the durability lost when using tools, weapons and armour
Sets the multiplier for the amount of damage vehicles deal to players
Sets the multiplier for the amount of damage vehicles deal to structures
Sets the multiplier for the amount of resources collected by vehicles
